title: Enable Multi-Board render in Panels  + Add Panel Test Fixturs
description: Adds support for rendering multiple boards within a single panel, ensuring independent drawing and correct order, along with test fixtures for validation.
body:
This PR adds first-class support for multiple boards within a single panel, across both grid and none layout modes.
It updates PCB rendering to correctly handle pcb_panel elements alongside pcb_board, ensuring each board/panel is drawn independently and in the correct order.

Additionally, the PR introduces dedicated example/test fixtures covering:

Grid layout panels with internal and external footprints

Non-layout panels with multiple boards

External KiCad footprint resolution inside panels

These fixtures validate correct positioning, rendering isolation, and footprint handling for multi-board panels, and serve as regression coverage for future panel-layout work.

title: feat: Add optional `display_name` field to `SourceComponentBase` interface and schema.
description: Adds an optional display_name field to the SourceComponentBase interface and schema, allowing for more descriptive identification of source components.

title: feat: Enable subtree extraction for nested subcircuits with hierarchical traversal
description: Refactored the buildSubtree function to recursively include child subcircuits when querying by subcircuit_id, ensuring complete subtree extraction for hierarchical circuit structures. Added subcircuit_ids and source_board_id options for enhanced flexibility. Included comprehensive tests validating nested subcircuit handling with real-world repro data. This enables proper isolation and manipulation of complex subcircuits, a critical feature for advanced circuit analysis workflows.
body: Refactored the buildSubtree function to recursively include child subcircuits when querying by subcircuit_id, ensuring complete subtree extraction for hierarchical circuit structures. Added subcircuit_ids and source_board_id options for enhanced flexibility. Included comprehensive tests validating nested subcircuit handling with real-world repro data. This enables proper isolation and manipulation of complex subcircuits, a critical feature for advanced circuit analysis workflows.

title: Add format checking CI workflow and format codebase
description: Add GitHub Actions workflow to check code formatting on pushes and PRs to main branch and format entire codebase using Biome formatter, adding trailing commas, fixing indentation, and improving readability.
body:
Summary
- Add GitHub Actions workflow (bun-formatcheck.yml) to check code formatting on pushes and PRs to main branch
- Format entire codebase using Biome formatter, adding trailing commas, fixing indentation, and improving readability
- Add format and format:check scripts to package.json
- Minor formatting fixes across TypeScript files, tests, and config files for consistency

title: Add KiCad footprint metadata prop to common components
description: Add a structured schema and TypeScript interfaces to capture KiCad footprint metadata, allowing components to include richer footprint information for export and round-trip workflows.
body:
### Motivation
- Provide a structured schema to capture KiCad footprint metadata (properties, attributes, pads, models, etc.) so components can carry richer footprint information extracted from .kicad_mod files.
- Expose this metadata on the shared component props so all components can opt-in to include footprint-level details for export/round-trip workflows.

### Description
- Add a new schema and TypeScript interfaces in `lib/common/kicadFootprintMetadata.ts` implementing Zod validators for `KicadAt`, `KicadProperty`, `KicadFootprintProperties`, `KicadFootprintAttributes`, `KicadFootprintPad`, `KicadFootprintModel`, and `KicadFootprintMetadata`.
- Export the new schema from the package index via `lib/index.ts` by adding `export * from "./common/kicadFootprintMetadata"`.
- Add an optional `kicadFootprintMetadata?: KicadFootprintMetadata` prop to `CommonComponentProps` and wire the Zod prop `kicadFootprintMetadata: kicadFootprintMetadata.optional()` in `lib/common/layout.ts`.
- Regenerate the docs and type overviews so `generated/COMPONENT_TYPES.md` and `generated/PROPS_OVERVIEW.md` reflect the new metadata types and the added prop.

### Testing
- Ran typechecking with `bunx tsc --noEmit` which completed successfully.
- Ran formatting with `bun run format` which completed successfully.
- Regenerated artifacts with `bun scripts/generate-component-types.ts`, `bun scripts/generate-manual-edits-docs.ts`, `bun scripts/generate-readme-docs.ts`, and `bun scripts/generate-props-overview.ts`, all of which completed successfully and updated `generated/COMPONENT_TYPES.md` and `generated/PROPS_OVERVIEW.md`.

------
[Codex Task](https://chatgpt.com/codex/tasks/task_b_697174f8d334832e9e8515cde8d47085)

title: Add outline support to copper pour props
description: Allows copperpour  to accept an explicit polygon outline so copper pours can follow boardshape outlines similar to the board outline field and support more precise pour geometry.
body:
### Motivation
- Allow `<copperpour />` to accept an explicit polygon outline so copper pours can follow board/shape outlines similar to the board `outline` field and support more precise pour geometry.

### Description
- Import `Point` and `point` from `lib/common/point` and add `outline?: Point[]` to the `CopperPourProps` interface.
- Add `outline: z.array(point).optional()` to the `copperPourProps` Zod schema to validate the new field.
- Regenerated documentation artifacts so the new `outline` field appears in `README.md`, `generated/COMPONENT_TYPES.md`, and `generated/PROPS_OVERVIEW.md`.

### Testing
- Ran the generation scripts `bun scripts/generate-component-types.ts`, `bun scripts/generate-manual-edits-docs.ts`, `bun scripts/generate-readme-docs.ts`, and `bun scripts/generate-props-overview.ts`, and they completed successfully.
- Typechecked the project with `bunx tsc --noEmit`, which succeeded.
- Ran `bun run format`, which completed successfully and formatted files.

------
[Codex Task](https://chatgpt.com/codex/tasks/task_b_697150535318832e81ab63bf3a07b84d)

body:

### Description

title: Add autorouter `availableJumperTypes` option and regenerate docs
description: Adds an availableJumperTypes option to the autorouter configuration, allowing users to restrict jumper footprint choices, and regenerates documentation to reflect this change.
body:
### Motivation
- Add a way to restrict autorouter jumper footprint choices by introducing an `availableJumperTypes` option on the autorouter config so routings can target specific jumper packages.
- Keep generated artifacts in sync with source changes so consumers and docs reflect the new option.

### Description
- Add `availableJumperTypes?: Array<"1206x4" | "0603">` to the `AutorouterConfig` interface in `lib/components/group.ts` and expose it in the exported type.
- Add the matching Zod validator `availableJumperTypes: z.array(z.enum(["1206x4","0603"])) .optional()` to the `autorouterConfig` schema.
- Regenerate `generated/COMPONENT_TYPES.md`, `generated/PROPS_OVERVIEW.md`, and `README.md`; the generation also introduced related `solderMaskMarginLeft/Right/Top/Bottom` fields via the generation scripts.

### Testing
- Ran `bun scripts/generate-component-types.ts` and it completed successfully.
- Ran `bun scripts/generate-manual-edits-docs.ts` and it completed successfully.
- Ran `bun scripts/generate-readme-docs.ts` and `bun scripts/generate-props-overview.ts` and both completed successfully.
- Ran `bunx tsc --noEmit` and `bun run format` and both completed without errors.

------
[Codex Task](https://chatgpt.com/codex/tasks/task_b_697071ae19cc832ea26b201acb8286bc)

title: Add optional displayName to common component props
description: Add an optional displayName property to the CommonComponentProps interface and update related documentation and validation schemas accordingly.
body:
### Motivation

- Provide an optional `displayName` alongside `name` for normal components so components can carry a separate human-facing label.

### Description

- Add `displayName?: string` to the `CommonComponentProps` interface in `lib/common/layout.ts`.
- Add `displayName: z.string().optional()` to the `commonComponentProps` zod schema so runtime validation and inferred types include the field.
- Regenerate documentation outputs so `displayName` appears in `generated/COMPONENT_TYPES.md`, `generated/PROPS_OVERVIEW.md`, and `README.md`.

### Testing

- Ran the generation scripts `bun scripts/generate-component-types.ts`, `bun scripts/generate-manual-edits-docs.ts`, `bun scripts/generate-readme-docs.ts`, and `bun scripts/generate-props-overview.ts`, which completed successfully.
- Ran typecheck with `bunx tsc --noEmit`, which succeeded.
- Ran formatter with `bun run format`, which succeeded.
- Attempted `bun update --latest some-dep`, which failed with a 404 for the placeholder package and did not affect the change.

title: Add warning for manual board positioning in automatic panel layouts
description: Adds a warning for users when manual board positioning is used in automatic panel layouts, indicating that the manual coordinates will be ignored.
body:
When panels use automatic layout modes (like layoutMode="grid"), boards with manual pcbX/pcbY positioning now emit a source_property_ignored_warning to alert users that these coordinates will be ignored in favor of the automatic layout. This prevents confusion when manual positioning conflicts with panel layout algorithms.
The warning message clearly explains which properties are being ignored and why, improving the developer experience by making the behavior explicit rather than silent. Updated tests verify that warnings are properly emitted for boards with conflicting positioning in automatic layout panels.

title: feat: Implement per-board DRC checks for multi-board circuits
description: Introduces isolated Design Rule Checks (DRC) for individual boards within multi-board panels or subcircuits, ensuring precise error isolation and reporting.
body:
Introduce isolated Design Rule Checks (DRC) for individual boards within multi-board panels or subcircuits. Previously, DRC errors were validated globally across the entire circuit, leading to inaccurate reporting in complex designs with multiple PCBs. This implementation runs DRC checks per board using subcircuit hierarchy, ensuring precise error isolation and reporting.
Key Changes
- Modified Board.ts: Updated DRC execution to filter circuit elements by subcircuit subtree and run checks individually per board, replacing global validation with isolated checks.
- Added per-board DRC test: Comprehensive test validating DRC isolation in multi-board panels with overlapping errors, ensuring errors are scoped correctly to their respective boards.
This fundamentally improves DRC accuracy and usability for multi-board designs, enabling proper error scoping that was previously impossible.

title: Fix outline translation calculation for boards with custom outlines
description: Fixes outline translation calculation for boards with custom outlines to ensure correct centering for all board types, not just those in panels.
body:
Summary
- Fixed outline translation logic in Board.ts to always calculate translation when an outline is present, not just for boards inside panels
- Updated test key generation in repro80 for better uniqueness
- Added new test case for polygon boards in panels with tab-routing to verify the fix
Changes
- Removed the this._panelPositionOffset condition from outline bounds calculation
- Changed board key from simple index to coordinate-based string
- Added comprehensive test with polygon-shaped boards containing resistors
This ensures outline centering works correctly for all board types, not just those in panels. The new test verifies the behavior with custom polygon outlines in panelized layouts.

title: Render KiCad library components with name="REF**"
description: Changes the component instantiation in KiCad library conversion to use a fixed reference name REF instead of component-specific names, ensuring consistent naming in generated circuit JSON and footprints.
body:
### Motivation
- Ensure KiCad library conversion renders components with a stable reference name so generated circuit JSON and footprints use the expected placeholder instead of component-specific names.

### Description
- In `lib/shared/convert-to-kicad-library.tsx` replace `runner.add(<Component name={componentName} />)` with `runner.add(<Component name="REF**" />)` so components are instantiated with a fixed `name` during conversion.

### Testing
- Ran `bunx tsc --noEmit` and `bun run format`, and both completed successfully.

title: Sync config schema JSON with TS definition
description: Synchronizes the JSON schema with the TypeScript configuration definition, adding a new cloud flag and enforcing compile-time checks to prevent schema mismatches.
body:
### Motivation
- Keep the published JSON schema in sync with the TypeScript config shape so tooling and consumers see the same properties.
- Document the new cloud flag so it can be validated by editors and schema-aware tools.
- Prevent regressions where TypeScript schema additions are not mirrored into the JSON schema by enforcing a compile-time check.

### Description
- Add `alwaysUseLatestTscircuitOnCloud` to `types/tscircuit.config.schema.json` as a boolean with a description. 
- Add a type-level assertion file `types/tscircuit.config.schema.assert.ts` that imports the TS `projectConfigSchema` and the JSON schema and verifies top-level keys and nested `build` keys match via TypeScript conditional types. 
- Enable JSON module imports in `tsconfig.json` by setting `resolveJsonModule: true` so the assertion file can import the JSON schema.

### Testing
- Ran `bunx tsc --noEmit` to type-check the repository and validate the assertion file, which succeeded. 
- Ran `bun run format` to apply formatting, which completed successfully.

------
[Codex Task](https://chatgpt.com/codex/tasks/task_b_697153faa110832e874e0fb72956ecb1)

description: Allows KiCad PCM generation to use a custom deployment URL so generated PCM repository and package download URLs can point to non-default deployments.
body:
### Motivation
- Allow KiCad PCM generation to use a custom deployment URL so generated PCM repository and package download URLs can point to non-default deployments.

### Description
- Read `TSCIRCUIT_DEPLOYMENT_URL`, trim trailing slashes, and use it as the `baseUrl` when generating PCM assets with a fallback to the existing `https://{author}--{packageName}.tscircuit.app` pattern; change applied in `cli/build/build-kicad-pcm.ts`.

### Testing

- Ran `bun run format` and it passed.

title: Gate TraceWidthSolver by connection nominal widths
description: Modifies the TraceWidthSolver to adjust trace widths based on nominal widths specified in connections, enhancing routing accuracy.
body:
- **Gate TraceWidthSolver by connection nominal widths and update tests/fixtures**
- **format**
- **update snapshot and fix a test**


TraceWidthSolver now looks for nominalTraceWidth on each connection and, when present, expands the trace width accordingly; if its not present, it does nothing.

Next, Im going to update core so that when we generate the simple route JSON for ground and power, we include a nominalTraceWidth field.

title: Populate default footprint metadata and mark silkscreen reference text
description: Ensure generated .kicad_mod footprints include KiCad-like defaults (descrtags, properties, embedded fonts, and attr) so library output matches real KiCad expectations. Ensure silkscreen text that matches a component name is emitted as a KiCad reference text element so referencevalue text are handled consistently.
body:
### Motivation
- Ensure generated `.kicad_mod` footprints include KiCad-like defaults (descr/tags, properties, embedded fonts, and attr) so library output matches real KiCad expectations.
- Ensure silkscreen text that matches a component name is emitted as a KiCad `reference` text element so reference/value text are handled consistently.

### Description
- Add defaults and sanitization in `lib/kicad-library/stages/ExtractFootprintsStage.ts`: set `descr`/`tags` when missing, add `embeddedFonts = no`, infer and set `attr.type` from pad kinds, and populate default `property` entries for `Reference`, `Value`, `Datasheet`, and `Description` using `TextEffects`/`TextEffectsFont`.
- Mark silkscreen-created footprint texts as reference text in `lib/pcb/stages/AddFootprintsStage.ts` by setting `fpText.type = "reference"` when the silkscreen text equals the source component name.
- Update tests in `tests/kicad-library/kicad-library-converter1.test.tsx` and `tests/kicad-library/kicad-library-converter2.test.tsx` to use `name=

------

title: chore: bump version to v0.0.35
description: Automated package update

title: Use relative 3D model paths in generated footprints
description: Standardizes generated 3D model references in KiCad footprint modules to use project-relative paths instead of KIPRJMOD URIs, ensuring compatibility with projects expecting repository-relative locations.
body:
### Motivation
- KiCad footprint modules were being generated with `${KIPRJMOD}` URIs which don't work for projects that expect repository-relative 3D model locations.
- The change standardizes generated 3D model references to a project-relative layout so exported `.kicad_mod` files reference `../../3dmodels/...` paths.

### Description
- Update `ExtractFootprintsStage` to write 3D model paths as `../../3dmodels/${fpLibraryName}.3dshapes/${modelFilename}` when extracting footprints.
- Update `renameKicadFootprint` to rewrite existing model paths that use `${KIPRJMOD}` or any `3dmodels/` pattern to the same relative `../../3dmodels/${kicadLibraryName}.3dshapes/${filename}` format.
- Path handling now tolerates both POSIX and Windows separators when extracting filenames from model paths.

### Testing
- Ran `bun test tests/kicad-library/kicad-library-converter1.test.tsx` and the test passed.
- Ran `bunx tsc --noEmit` for a TypeScript type check and it succeeded.
- Ran `bun run format` to apply formatting which completed successfully.

------

title: chore: bump version to 0.0.56
description: Automated package update

title: Render PCB Panel Outline Before Board to Support Panelized Layouts
description: Adds support for drawing pcb_panel elements and integrates them into the render pipeline ahead of the board outline, establishing a correct panel  board  copper draw order for accurate visualization of panelized PCB layouts.
body: Adds support for drawing pcb_panel elements and integrates them into the render pipeline ahead of the board outline. The panel is rendered as the outer manufacturing boundary, with an optional substrate fill and a dedicated outline stroke, while preserving existing board and copper layering behavior. This establishes a correct panel board copper draw order and enables accurate visualization of panelized PCB layouts. Snapshot tests are included to lock rendering behavior. yalced and tested on pcb-viewer

title: Fix crossHatch LightBurn incompatibility by exporting 1/0 values instead of true/false
description: Fixes LightBurn incompatibility by exporting crossHatch property as numeric values (10) instead of string values (truefalse) in XML.
body: ### Problem The crossHatch property in CutSetting was exported as XML with "true"/"false" string values, which LightBurn cannot properly parse. This caused crossHatch settings to not work correctly when importing generated files into LightBurn, as the application expects numeric boolean format ("1" for true, "0" for false). ### Solution Modified the formatValue method in CutSettingPropertyElement to output "1" for true and "0" for false specifically for the crossHatch property. This change: - Aligns with LightBurn's expected XML format (as seen in fixture files) - Maintains backward compatibility for parsing (the library already accepts both formats) - Only affects crossHatch output - other boolean properties remain unchanged ### Testing - Verified output format: crossHatch: true ` `, crossHatch: false `` LightBurn:

title: chore: bump version
description: Updates the package version from 0.0.13 to 0.0.14 in package.json

title: Enforce LightBurn XML Standard: ShapeGroup Now Wraps Child Shapes in <Children> Element
description: Standardizes ShapeGroup XML output by wrapping child shapes in a Children element to comply with LightBurn requirements while maintaining backward compatibility.
body: ShapeGroup XML output previously nested child shapes directly, but LightBurn requires them wrapped in . This change standardizes the serialization while maintaining backward-compatible parsing. Changes: - Added getXmlAttributes() override for proper Type="Group" attribute - Overrode toXml() to wrap children in element - Updated fromXmlJson() to parse both old (direct) and new (wrapped) formats - Added roundtrip test for ShapeGroup validation ### tested with bun link

body: - Added reusable UI components: Created Skeleton (with shimmer animation) and Spinner components in the UI library - Implemented media loading wrappers: - ImageWithSkeleton: Shows shimmer skeleton until image loads, with smooth fade-in transition - VideoWithLoader: Displays loading spinner and message until video is ready to play (before autoplay starts) - Updated landing page: Replaced static and

title: Fix: Resolve useNavigate Router context errors in Cosmos workspace fixtures
description: Fixes useNavigate Router context errors in React Cosmos workspace fixtures by wrapping components in a Router context.
body: React Cosmos fixtures for workspace components (examples/blank-workspace.fixture.tsx and examples/workspace.fixture.tsx) were failing with "useNavigate() may be used only in the context of a <Router> component" because WorkspaceContent uses the useNavigate hook from react-router-dom, but fixtures render in isolation without Router context.

title: Add Copper Cut Fill Support with Configurable Margin Controls
description: Adds support for copper cut fill functionality in PCB burn operations with configurable margin controls.
body:
This PR integrates the newly updated circuit-json-to-lbrn library options to enable copper cut fill functionality in PCB burn operations. Key changes include:
- New Options Added:
  - includeCopperCutFill: Boolean toggle to enable/disable copper cut fill generation (default: false)
  - copperCutFillMargin: Numeric control for adjusting fill margin in mm (default: 0)

title: Fix LBRN SVG Preview by Awaiting Async convertCircuitJsonToLbrn Conversion
description: Fixes the LBRN SVG preview rendering issue by awaiting the async convertCircuitJsonToLbrn function, ensuring correct SVG generation instead of a blank canvas.
body:
This PR updates the SVG preview pipeline to correctly handle the recent async change to convertCircuitJsonToLbrn, which now returns a Promise<LightBurnProject> instead of a synchronous value.

By awaiting the conversion result before generating the LightBurn SVG, the LBRN preview is restored and no longer renders as a blank white canvas. The fix is applied consistently across both the preview hook (useSvgGeneration) and the workspace conversion logic to prevent silent failures and ensure correct rendering behavior going forward.
